<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Control

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Sends a simple command to the vehicle's driver / gunner (air vehicles ignore it). See also [[vehicleMoveInfo]].<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> important </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Doesn't seem to work if AI driver is alone, needs another unit in the vehicle (could be another AI or player) that is set as [[setEffectiveCommander]]. If driver is [[effectiveCommander]] it will refuse any drive commands.</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3 </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Due to some sort of a bug when vehicle is ordered turning ("LEFT" or "RIGHT"), it locks vehicle ability to respond to any other commands properly. Always use "STOPTURNING" to cancel turning before issuing other move commands</value></part></template> 
<br>''Gunner commands''
* <tt>"FIRE"</tt>
* <tt>"CEASE FIRE"</tt>
* <tt>"MANUAL FIRE"</tt>
* <tt>"CANCEL MANUAL FIRE"</tt>
* <tt>"KEY FIRE"</tt>
<br>''Driver move commands''
* <tt>"FORWARD"</tt> - move forward
* <tt>"FAST"</tt> - move forward, fast
* <tt>"SLOW"</tt> - move forward, slow
* <tt>"STOP"</tt> - stop moving forward or backward
* <tt>"BACK"</tt> - move backward
* <tt>"KEY UP"</tt>
* <tt>"KEY DOWN"</tt>
* <tt>"KEY FAST"</tt>
* <tt>"KEY SLOW"</tt>
<br>''Driver turn commands''
* <tt>"LEFT"</tt> - turn left, while moving or not
* <tt>"RIGHT"</tt> - turn right, while moving or not
* <tt>"STOPTURNING"</tt> - cancel turning  (special case, normally would be called by the engine when LEFT or RIGHT turn key is released by the player) <template><title>Since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.77</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>true</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> vehicleName '''sendSimpleCommand''' command

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value>  vehicleName: [[Object]]
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value>  command: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[vehicle]] [[player]] [[sendSimpleCommand]] "STOP";</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[vehicleMoveInfo]], [[useAISteeringComponent]], [[effectiveCommander]], [[setEffectiveCommander]], [[enableAI]], [[disableAI]], [[enableAIFeature]], [[enableSentences]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">
<dt class="note">[[User:Ceeeb|Ceeeb]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Valid commands include: "FORWARD", "SLOW", "FAST" "BACK", "LEFT", "RIGHT", "STOP", "FIRE", "CEASE FIRE", "MANUAL FIRE", "CANCEL MANUAL FIRE". There may be more. <br><br>
Only vehicles crewed by a player can use sendSimpleCommand.

<dd class="notedate">
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">Other commands that work: "KEY FIRE", "KEY FAST", "KEY SLOW", "KEY DOWN", "KEY UP". These will simulate key presses.<br><br>
In Arma 3 player doesn't always need to be in the vehicle to give commands.


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
